author: kilasuit
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

As part of PowerShell runtime configuration I may want to set certain things in the `powershell.config.json` file
On new upgrades of PowerShell, my settings in this file should not be lost and should be combined with any additional new settings that would be set as part of the install, so that I don't need to set these on each upgrade.

This would help alleviate some concern in #15644 in management of this file


### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

_No response_

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: In Release version we haven't the config file and use default setting if I remember correctly.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
@iSazonov is correct that the preview version comes with a config so that experimental features are enabled, but stable builds (and release candidate builds) should not have that file.

We should address this as part of the other issue to not have configuration in $PSHOME and separate default config (shipped with PS7) and user system config.

comments.author: iuooip
comments.body:
Each installation of a new stable version nukes my `powershell.config.json` file. In result pwsh do not want to start:
```
Unhandled exception. System.Management.Automation.PSInvalidOperationException: PowerShell has stopped working because of a security issue: Cannot read the configuration file: C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7\powershell.config.json
 ---> System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not find file 'C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7\powershell.config.json'.
File name: 'C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7\powershell.config.json'
(...)
```
This is annoying.
I have replaced it with a symbolic link and moved it to cloud drive backed up location to just simply restore it every time but this is not the solution I want to have it in place forever.

title: Inplace upgrade without replacing PowerShell.config.json file
